title: Water Purification
description: Essential first step: learn multiple water purification methods from boiling to chemical treatment, critical for survival in any environment.

title: Fire Starting
description: Master friction fire, tinder preparation, and advanced ignition techniques for reliable fire starting in wet, cold, or harsh conditions.

title: Herbal Medicine
description: Identify, harvest, and prepare medicinal plants for treating wounds, infections, pain, and illness without modern pharmaceuticals.

title: Navigation & Mapping
description: Navigate without instruments using celestial navigation, map reading, and natural sign interpretation to find your way in wilderness.

title: Sanitation & Hygiene
description: Establish hygiene practices and waste disposal systems to prevent disease and illness in survival or post-collapse scenarios.

title: Food Preservation
description: Preserve seasonal abundance through smoking, salting, drying, fermenting, and canning to maintain food security year-round.

title: Trapping & Hunting
description: Set snares, traps, and track game animals for protein acquisition; learn ethical hunting and sustainable harvesting practices.

title: Agriculture Basics
description: Grow vegetables and grains with primitive methods, including soil preparation, seed selection, pest control, and harvesting.

title: Animal Husbandry
description: Raise livestock for food, fiber, and labor including chickens, goats, sheep, and other animals suited to survival conditions.

title: Food Foraging
description: Identify, ethically harvest, and prepare wild plants, mushrooms, and insects as nutritious supplements to your survival diet.

title: Shelter Building
description: Construct shelters from available materials to provide protection from elements; includes tepees, dugouts, sod houses, and more.

title: Carpentry & Woodworking
description: Shape and join wood for buildings, furniture, tools, and structures using hand tools and traditional techniques.

title: Clay & Earthworks
description: Work with earth materials including clay, mud, stone, and adobe for durable construction in resource-limited environments.

title: Energy Systems
description: Generate and distribute power through water wheels, windmills, and renewable systems without grid dependence.

title: Forging & Metalwork
description: Heat and shape metal using forges and anvils to create tools, weapons, and hardware essential for survival and production.

title: Pottery & Ceramics
description: Fire clay into pottery and ceramics for storage, cooking, and daily use in pre-industrial production environments.

title: Cordage & Textiles
description: Create strong cordage from plant fibers, leather, and other materials for binding, rigging, and construction projects.

title: Soap Making
description: Produce soap from rendered animal fat and wood ash lye for hygiene and sanitation without commercial products.

title: Weaving & Textiles
description: Weave fibers into cloth, blankets, and textiles using simple looms and hand techniques for clothing and household items.

title: Knot Tying & Rigging
description: Master essential knots and rigging techniques for securing loads, climbing, sailing, and rescue operations.

title: Primitive Weapons
description: Craft bows, arrows, spears, and other primitive weapons for hunting, defense, and security in survival situations.

title: Community Governance
description: Establish fair governance structures, dispute resolution, and collective decision-making for stable communities.

title: Survival Basics & First 72 Hours
description: Shelter building, fire starting, water finding, signaling, priorities of survival, psychology of crisis, and immediate action plans.

title: Winter Survival Systems
description: Staying alive in -40°F Minnesota winters. Layered clothing, snow shelters, hypothermia treatment, fire in snow, and vehicle survival.

title: Foraging, Hunting & Fishing
description: Wild edible plants, trapping, snaring, bow hunting, fishing techniques, insect eating, and game processing.

title: Weather & Geology
description: Weather forecasting without instruments, cloud identification, natural disaster prep, soil science, and seasonal patterns.

title: Primitive Technology & Stone Age
description: Flint knapping, fire by friction, stone tools, bone tools, clay vessels, cordage, shelter from raw materials, and paleolithic skills.

title: Animal Tracking & Wilderness Signs
description: Track identification, scat analysis, gait patterns, trail reading, bird language, predator signs, and wilderness awareness.

title: Disaster Triage & MCI
description: START/JumpSTART triage systems, mass casualty incident management, field hospital setup, and resource allocation.

title: Search & Rescue Operations
description: Grid search patterns, rope rescue, water/avalanche rescue, wilderness tracking, and evacuation methods.

title: Fire Suppression & Wildland Fire
description: Fire behavior, wildland/structural firefighting, firebreaks, pumps, controlled burns, and community response.

title: Medical & Survival Medicine
description: First aid, wound care, field surgery, common illness treatment, vital signs, medication references, and emergency protocols.

title: Dentistry & Midwifery
description: Dental care without dentists, tooth extraction, filling cavities, childbirth, midwifery, neonatal care, and women's health.

title: Herbalism & Medicinal Plants
description: 20 essential medicinal plants, preparation methods, dosage, growing a medicine garden, herbal first aid, and pharmacopeia.

title: Water Purification
description: Boiling, filtration, chemical treatment, solar disinfection, well construction, rainwater harvesting, and water testing.

title: Sanitation & Public Health
description: Sewage systems, waste management, disease prevention, quarantine protocols, hygiene, and epidemic response.

title: Veterinary Medicine
description: Animal diagnosis, treatment protocols, surgery, parasites, infectious diseases, preventive care, and livestock health management.

title: Optics & Vision Care
description: Lens grinding, eyeglass making, eye testing, vision correction, optical instruments, and ocular health without modern medicine.

title: Field Surgery & Emergency Procedures
description: Wound debridement, suturing, fracture reduction, amputation protocols, anesthesia, surgical instruments, and sterile technique.

title: Herbal Antibiotics & Natural Medicine
description: Antimicrobial plants, preparation methods, dosing protocols, infection treatment without pharmaceuticals, and natural antiseptics.

title: Midwifery & Childbirth
description: Prenatal care, labor stages, delivery techniques, postpartum care, newborn assessment, complications, and breastfeeding support.

title: Prosthetics & Adaptive Technology
description: Limb prosthetics, mobility aids, assistive devices, wheelchair construction, hearing aids, and rehabilitation techniques.

title: Mental Health & Counseling
description: Crisis counseling, trauma processing, grief support, addiction recovery, community mental health, and psychological first aid.

title: Vaccine Production & Immunization
description: Cowpox cultivation for smallpox immunity, tetanus antitoxin, rabies prevention, vaccination schedules, and community immunization programs.

title: Pharmaceutical Production
description: Aspirin from willow bark, penicillin cultivation, quinine extraction, morphine, atropine, digitalis — dosage and quality control.

description: Field blood typing (ABO/Rh), emergency transfusion protocols, blood storage, IV fluid preparation, and hemorrhage management.

title: Orthopedics & Fracture Management
description: Fracture identification, splinting, traction, cast making, joint injuries, and spinal precautions

description: Local anesthesia, herbal sedatives, nerve blocks, non-pharmacological pain control techniques

title: Obstetric Emergencies
description: Breech delivery, shoulder dystocia, postpartum hemorrhage, eclampsia, emergency C-section, neonatal resuscitation

title: Burn Treatment & Management
description: Burn classification, Rule of Nines, Parkland formula fluid resuscitation, escharotomy, skin grafting, and rehabilitation.

title: Infectious Disease Management
description: Isolation protocols, epidemic response, contact tracing, quarantine, vector control, and antibiotic stewardship.

title: Toxicology & Poison Management
description: Poison identification, antidotes, toxidromes, activated charcoal, venomous animals, and decontamination.

description: Temporary/permanent fillings, extraction mechanics, nerve blocks, abscess drainage, and improvised dental tools.

description: Animal-to-human disease transmission, quarantine, carcass disposal, slaughterhouse hygiene, and PPE protocols.

description: Historical anesthetic methods, nerve blocks, herbal analgesics, patient monitoring, and non-chemical pain management for field surgery.

description: Impression taking, stone models, vulcanite & acrylic denture bases, tooth fabrication, fitting, and adhesive formulation.

description: Lens grinding, eye testing, frame manufacturing, diopter calculations, and magnifying glass construction.

description: Seed saving, crop rotation, companion planting, soil management, composting, pest control, and seasonal planning.
